New Records: Emilio Nsue’s second hat-trick in international football helped Equatorial Guinea register their first-ever H2H victory over Guinea-Bissau.
Key Match Events: Emilio Nsue scored a hat-trick, including an expertly-taken one-on-one finish and a clinical strike past Djoco.
Josete Miranda came close to doubling Equatorial Guinea’s lead but was denied by the crossbar.
An own goal from Esteban Orozco brought Guinea-Bissau back to a level playing field.
VAR overturned a penalty decision against Equatorial Guinea, which was initially given for a clumsy challenge from Saúl Coco on Franculino Djú.
Miranda volleyed Equatorial Guinea back ahead shortly after the restart.
Nsue slotted home his second goal from the back post courtesy of Basilio Ndong’s delivery.
Nsue completed his hat-trick with another one-on-one strike past Djoco.
Zé Turbo fired in a late consolation goal for Guinea-Bissau in second-half stoppage-time.
Pre-Game Insights: Before the tournament, this match was seen as a straight duel to avoid last place in Group A.
Post-Match Reflections: This comprehensive victory for Equatorial Guinea provisionally lifts them above Ivory Coast to the top of Group A.
Guinea-Bissau now have it all to do if they want to qualify for the knockout stages, as even a victory in their last group game might ultimately end up not being enough.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match took place at the Olympic Stadium of Ebimpé.
Both sets of supporters showcased impressive dance moves in the stands during halftime.
